p: The incorporation of artemisinin into soil inhibited the growth of above-ground lettuce plants, with EC 50 = 2.5 mg/Kg sandy soil, but the germination was not arrested up to 100 mg/Kg soil [ 139]. Furthermore, adding A. annua leaves containing 0.81â€“0.22% artemisinin in soil led to the inhibition of Zea mays growth [ 140]. Artemisinin is phytotoxic in concentrations comparable to those of commercial herbicides and has a good activity in soil [ 110].
